revision.text:
{{Speciesbox | image = WhiteFlower.jpg | image_caption = A flower with six, rather than five petals | genus = Nymphoides | species = indica | authority = ([[Carl Linnaeus|L.]]) [[Otto Kuntze|Kuntze]] }} [[File:Nymphoides indica (L.) Kuntze (4368355126).jpg|thumb|right|Plant habit]]
'''''Nymphoides indica''''' is an aquatic plant in the [[Menyanthaceae]], native to tropical areas around the world.<ref>{{citation |url=http://www.iucnredlist.org/details/168916/0 |title=IUCN Red List |accessdate=23 July 2016}}</ref> It is sometimes cultivated, and has become a minor weed in Florida, where it resembles the native ''[[Nymphoides aquatica]]''.<ref>[http://plants.ifas.ufl.edu/plant-directory/nymphoides-indica/ Center for Aquatic and Invasive Plants, University of Florida, Institute of Food and Agricultural Sciences]</ref> [[Common name]]s include '''banana plant''', '''robust marshwort''', and '''water snowflake'''.<ref>{{citation |url=https://npgsweb.ars-grin.gov/gringlobal/taxonomydetail.aspx?id=410544 |title=USDA GRIN Taxonomy |accessdate=23 July 2016}}</ref>
==Description== ''Nymphoides indica'' spreads by [[rhizome]]s, forming clusters of leaves, with clustered white flowers about 1 cm across. The flowers are sometimes described as having five petals,<ref>{{citation |chapter-url=http://www.efloras.org/florataxon.aspx?flora_id=2&taxon_id=200018199 |title=Flora of China |chapter=''Nymphoides indica'' (Linnaeus) Kuntze, Revis. Gen. Pl. 2: 429. 1891 |authors=Ting-nung Ho and Robert Ornduff}}</ref> but can have more.
==Voynich Manuscript== The [[Voynich Manuscript]] is a mysterious book written in code from [[Medieval]] times. It features various flora throughout the book. On page 6, a Nymphoides indica takes up most of the page.
[[File:Voynich_Manuscript_(6).jpg|400px|Page six of the Voynich Manuscript.]]
